ResourceHeader.ResourceName: STEREO-A In-Situ Measurements of Particles and CME Transients (IMPACT) Fluxgate Magnetometer (MAG) Burst Mode, Magnetic Field Vector, Radial-Tangential-Normal (RTN) Coordinates, Level 1 (L1), 31 ms Data
ResourceHeader.Description: This data product contains Level 1 0.03125-s or 32 Hz burst-mode values of solar wind magnetic field data measured by the IMPACT Magnetometer on STEREO-A in Radial-Tangential-Normal, RTN, coordinates.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the STEREO IMPACT Principal Investigator J.G. Luhmann for use of the Data and the key IMPACT Magnetometer personnel: C.W. Smith and the late M.H. Acuna.

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time
Parameter.Description: Epoch Time Tag, time since 0 AD, interval centered

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Vector Components and Vector Magnitude, RTN Cartesian Coordinates
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field, B, Vector Components and Vector Magnitude, Radial-Tangential-Normal, RTN, Cartesian coordinates

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Status Flag
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: IMPACT Magnetic Field Instrument Status Flag
Parameter.Caveats: IMPACT Magnetometer Status Flag encoded values: bi to bit 3: Magnetometer error counter, bi to bit 7: Magnetometer command counter, bit 8: Spare, bit 9: First, bit 10: Time, bit 11: Interface parity error flag (0=OK, 1=Fault), bit 12: Interface timeout error flag (0=OK, 1=Fault), bit 13: Analog to Digital Converter, ADC, calbration flag (0=Off, 1=On), bit 14: In-flight calibration flag (0=Off, 1=On), bit 15: Range flag (0=Low fields, high sensitivity, 1=High fields, low sensitivity), bit 16: Calibration flag (0=Old calibration, 1=New calibration), bit 17 ms added to sync correctly with IDPU, bit 18: 62.5 ms to 08 hz data (no longer used), bit 19: timestamp resync, the time stamp has been changed (i.e. th s glitch), bit 20: data rate resync, timestamps were calculated wit different Δt for mixed frequency data as the data rate was not synced properly so the records timestamps were calculated incorrectly, bit 21: derived from 32 hz Magnetometer data.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Magnitude Filter Value
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field Magnitude Filter Value, if the total magnetic field magnitude, B, is greater than the filter value, the data point is filtered out and replaced with fill values. It is expected that values greater than the filter value are spurious and non-physical.
